entry.dc:subject: webapps
entry.content:
Now that's a presentation I would have liked to attend. One of the Flickr developers, Cal Henderson to be exact, gave a presentation about the architecture of the Flickr website. I've been wondering sometimes already, how such a site would be built. I mean, they must be handling some serious loads.

Niall Kennedy has a pdf version of the slides. A good read for everyone remotely interested in technical details of webapps.

Via: weblogtoolscollection.com

entry.title: Mark is gone
entry.summary: Mark Pilgrim, of feedparser and feedvalidator fame, has stopped blogging. At least it seems so. His final post is rather short and his site no longer provides any kind of feeds. One could say it's no real surprise, since he...
entry.dc:subject: blogging
entry.content:
Mark Pilgrim, of feedparser and feedvalidator fame, has stopped blogging.

At least it seems so. His final post is rather short and his site no longer provides any kind of feeds. One could say it's no real surprise, since he made some hints in the past, and his post frequency was rather low in the last months.

Either way, I think that's rather sad. I really liked his writing style and his views on technical topics were always good for some new perspective and interesting insights.

I would really like to know, if he just stopped blogging, or if he stepped back from all his computer involvements (his column on xml.com, feedparser, Atom ...).

Whatever the case. Have more fun, Mark.
